    • Method Detail

      • canonicalRandom

        public static float canonicalRandom(float x,
                                    float y)
        Returns a random number in range (0,1) using a 'one liner I found on the internet' for point (x,y). This method has been known by the shader community for a long time.
        Parameters:
        x - any float
        y - any float
        Returns:
        a random number using the x,y values, returns a number in range (0, 1)

      • canonicalRandom

        public static float canonicalRandom(TNoise.Vec2 vec)
        Returns a random number in range (0,1) using a 'one liner I found on the internet' for a vector. This method has been known by the shader community for a long time.
        Parameters:
        vec - x,y values
        Returns:
        a random number using the x,y values, returns a number in range (0, 1)

      • valueNoise

        public static float valueNoise(float x,
                               float y)
        Returns a random value in range (0,1) using the point (x,y). This noise will look blocky and grid-like. Use perlin noise if you want it to look smooth.
        Parameters:
        x - any float
        y - any float
        Returns:
        valueNoise(x,y), returns a number in range (0, 1)

      • valueNoise

        public static float valueNoise(TNoise.Vec2 vec)
        Returns a random value in range (0,1) using the vector. This noise will look blocky and grid-like. Use perlin noise if you want it to look smooth.
        Parameters:
        vec - x,y values
        Returns:
        valueNoise(x,y), returns a number in range (0, 1)

      • morganMcguireNoise

        public static float morganMcguireNoise(float x,
                                       float y)
        Returns a 2D noise value in range (0,1) based on Morgan Mcguire's shader: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4dS3Wd
        Parameters:
        x - any float
        y - any float
        Returns:
        morganMcguireNoise(x,y), returns a number in range (0, 1)

      • perlinNoise

        public static float perlinNoise(float x,
                                float y)
        Returns perlin noise value in range (-1, 1) for point (x,y). This is the default perlin noise.
        Parameters:
        x - any float
        y - any float
        Returns:
        perlinNoise(x,y), returns a number in range (-1, 1)

      • perlinNoise

        public static float perlinNoise(TNoise.Vec2 vec)
        Returns perlin noise value in range (-1, 1) for point (x,y). This is the default perlin noise.
        Parameters:
        vec - any cev
        Returns:
        perlinNoise(x,y), returns a number in range (-1, 1)

      • fbmFilteredPerlinNoise

        public static float fbmFilteredPerlinNoise(float x,
                                           float y,
                                           int octaves)
        Returns a Fractional Brownian motion value for perlin noise with the specified octaves for point (x,y). This value is in range (-1, 1)
        Parameters:
        x - any float for perlinNoise
        y - any float for perlinNoise
        octaves - how many times this filter will be used
        Returns:
        'octaves times' filtered perlinNoise(x,y) with fbm, returns a number in range (-1, 1)

      • fbmFilteredPerlinNoise

        public static float fbmFilteredPerlinNoise(float x,
                                           float y)
        Returns a Fractional Brownian motion value for perlin noise with the specified octaves for point (x,y). This value is in range (-1, 1). This method does fbmFilteredPerlinNoise(float, float, int) with 4 octaves, returns a number in range (-1, 1).
        Parameters:
        x - any float for perlinNoise
        y - any float for perlinNoise
        Returns:
        fbm filtered noise

      • fbmFilteredPerlinNoise

        public static float fbmFilteredPerlinNoise(TNoise.Vec2 vec,
                                           int octaves)
        Returns a Fractional Brownian motion value for perlin noise with the specified octaves for a vector. This value is in range (-1, 1)
        Parameters:
        vec - any vector for perlinNoise
        octaves - how many times this filter will be used
        Returns:
        'octaves times' filtered perlinNoise(x,y) with fbm, returns a number in range (-1, 1)

      • fbmFilteredPerlinNoise

        public static float fbmFilteredPerlinNoise(TNoise.Vec2 vec)
        Returns a Fractional Brownian motion value for perlin noise with the specified octaves for a vector. This value is in range (-1, 1). This method does fbmFilteredPerlinNoise(Vec2, int) with 4 octaves, returns a number in range (-1, 1).
        Parameters:
        vec - any x,y values for perlinNoise
        Returns:
        fbm filtered noise

      • ridgeFilteredNoise

        public static float ridgeFilteredNoise(float noiseValue)
        Returns a ridge filtered noise value. This filter will make for example a mountain have sharper ridges. This value is in range (0, 1).
        Parameters:
        noiseValue - any noise value that is returned from any noise function
        Returns:
        noiseValue with ridge filter in range (0, 1)

      • exponentiallyFilteredNoise

        public static float exponentiallyFilteredNoise(float noiseValueBetweenZeroAndOne,
                                               int exponent)
        Returns the noise value ^ exponential. Will return in range (0,1) as long as noise value is in range (0,1).
        Parameters:
        noiseValueBetweenZeroAndOne - any noise value in range (0,1)
        exponent - an integer specifying how many times this filter will be applied
        Returns:
        'exponent times' filtered noiseValueBetweenZeroAndOne, in range (0,1) if noiseValue is in (0,1)

      • brokenPerlinNoise

        public static float brokenPerlinNoise(float x,
                                      float y,
                                      boolean isInteresting)
        This method is a not-working or alternatively weirdly-working perlin noise that I've wrote. I didn't delete this method because it looks weird and sometimes very random. You can set isInterestion boolean to any value to get a different effect as well. This method returns a number in [0, 1) interval
        Parameters:
        x - any float
        y - any float
        isInteresting - set it to anything you want just be consistent
        Returns:
        a number in [0, 1) interval
